news.title: The deadly cancers left behind by 50 years of success
news.summary: Half of people with cancer survive but lack of progress for some forms of disease is worrying experts.

news.title: Thirteen children died after falling from windows in six years
news.summary: Calls for landlords to prioritise faulty window repairs to avoid "entirely preventable" deaths.

news.title: National Guard troops appear in Washington DC as mayor rejects 'authoritarian push'
news.summary: Armoured vehicles were spotted at urban centres and tourist sites around the US capital on Tuesday evening.

news.title: Government expands police use of facial recognition vans
news.summary: The Home Office says the technology helps locate suspects but civil liberties groups warn of heightened surveillance.

news.title: Israel bombards Gaza City as UK and allies demand action against 'unfolding famine'
news.summary: The countries demanded "immediate, permanent and concrete steps" to facilitate the entry of aid to Gaza.

news.title: The Papers: Migrants arrive at 'record speed' and 'Fresh inheritance tax grab'
news.summary: The migrant crisis dominated the papers on Wednesday, as small boat migrant numbers hit 50,000 under Labour.

news.title: I didn't go to uni - now I work as a celebrity photographer
news.summary: The BBC speaks to four young people who say skipping university does not have to mean missing out on success.

news.title: Why are Trump and Putin meeting in Alaska and when will it happen?
news.summary: Trump says he will meet with the Russian leader in the "great state of Alaska".

news.title: Driving theory test to include CPR first aid questions
news.summary: Experts hope to boost cardiac arrest survival rates, with 2.4 million people sitting the test each year.

news.title: South Korea's former first lady arrested for corruption
news.summary: Kim Keon Hee, 52, denies all the charges against her, telling reporters she is a "person of no importance".
